intro: Alectra alba, commonly known as the white sandwort, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically succulent and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to arid environments. Alectra alba thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
